definition: to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: The guy always wants to make out with Jenny.
sentences.chinese: 哪個傢伙總想和珍妮套近乎。

sentences.english: Follow me. Trouble you please bypass.
sentences.chinese: 跟我套近乎旳麻煩你請繞道。

sentences.english: Remember, they love money, so just pretend like you own a goldmine and you"re in the club."
sentences.chinese: 只要你裝得很有錢的樣女他們便會跟你套近乎。

sentences.english: Be friendly, but not overly casual or familiar.
sentences.chinese: 要友善，但不要過度隨便或套近乎。

sentences.english: Linda is trying to cultivate all the big shots in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 琳達千萬百計的和芝加哥的大人物們套近乎。

sentences.english: After the speeches, I got off the stage and began working the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 演講結束之後，我走下講臺，與羣衆套近乎。

sentences.english: Remember, % they love money, so just pretend like you own a goldmine and you're in the club.
sentences.chinese: 簒只要你裝得很有錢的樣子他們就會跟你套近乎。

sentences.english: But Microsoft has rejected suggestions it was being sneaky or underhanded by approaching Mr Jelliffe.
sentences.chinese: 微軟已否認其與傑利夫套近乎是種卑鄙或下流的手段。

sentences.english: I saw you schmoozing the manager of the accounts department.
sentences.chinese: 我看到你和財務部的經理套近乎。

sentences.english: Remember, they love money, so just pretend like you own a goldmine and you’re in the club.
sentences.chinese: 只要你裝得很有錢的樣子他們就會跟你套近乎。
